Art. 4.225. 
Sale of movable property 
The chargee is obliged to arrange for the sale of all movable property, as provided for in Article 4.55, ¤ 1, with the exception, however, of those referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3.
Furnishings and other movable property which would have been included in the disposition on the express condition that they be kept in kind, are returned in the state in which they are at the time of restitution.
The livestock and utensils used to farm the land are deemed to be included in the gifts or legacies of the said land. The encumbered party is only obliged to have them prised and appraised, in order to give them an equal value at the time of restitution.
